description: One-minute skill: Termites: The Invisible Demolition Crew.

hook.text: Termites cause $5 billion in property damage in the US every yearâ€”more than fires, floods, and tornadoes combined.

buildup.text: Subterranean termites live underground and build mud tubes up foundations to reach wood. Colonies top a million.

discovery.text: They eat wood from the inside out. A beam can look solid but be completely hollowâ€”you discover it when a wall collapses.

twist.text: Homeowners insurance won't cover termite damageâ€”it's classed as preventable maintenance, making it all your cost.

climax.text: Annual inspections cost $75-$150. Catching termites early saves the average homeowner over $8,000 in structural repairs.

punchline.text: They eat your house, and insurance won't pay.

quiz.question: Why is termite damage typically not covered by homeowners insurance?
options: It's classified as preventable through regular maintenance
The damage is usually cosmetic, not structural
Termite colonies are considered an act of nature
